intro: Paracolpodium altaicum subsp. leucolepis, commonly known as the white-stemmed colpodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas.
